meanings.definition: To try to persuade a customer to buy a more expensive item or upgrade a purchase.
meanings.sent1: The salesperson will upsell the customer to a larger size for only a little more money.
meanings.sent2: It is common for businesses to upsell customers on accessories when they buy a new phone.
meanings.sent3: The clever salesperson managed to upsell the customer on a gold-plated version of the product.
meanings.sent4: She skillfully used her charm to upsell the customer to the premium package.
meanings.sent5: The company's strategy to upsell customers on luxury items proved to be very successful.

meanings.definition: The act of convincing a customer to purchase additional products or services.
meanings.sent1: The upsell at the checkout counter tempted the customer to buy more than planned.
meanings.sent2: The upsell of insurance policies with car rentals is a common practice in the industry.
meanings.sent3: The upsell of a dessert with the meal made the customer smile.
meanings.sent4: The upsell of a spa package with the hotel room was a great deal.
meanings.sent5: The upsell of a warranty with the electronic device provided peace of mind.
